DataElement.preferredName: DICOM Image Pixel Measurement Sequence Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The description of the physical characteristics of the pixels in the frame.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Device-In-Use Domain DICOM Image Pixel Measurement Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device-in-use._A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device-in-use.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device-in-use.

Property.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.:A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
